wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.test

Class TestImageDomainOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.test.TestImageDomainOperation

  • public class TestImageDomainOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    remy Allows to test operations on an image domain , such as cropping or adding margins.
    See Also:
    ImageDomainOperation

      • testImageSandwich

        public static void testImageSandwich(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                     CoordinateAxis axis,
                                     int coordMinInsert)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to test concatenation of two images along one axis
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - source image path on disk
        axis - The axis along which to place one image domain after the other.
        coordMinInsert - The minimal coordinate of the planes of argument image domain within the resulting image. The first slice (with coordinate Z=0) of image is mapped onto the slice with coordinate Z=zCoordMin.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Allows to test addition of slices from one image to another (without slice copy)
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - source image path on disk, which shall be added to itself.

      • testEnlargedImage

        public static void testEnlargedImage(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                     int xMargin,
                                     int yMargin,
                                     int zMargin,
                                     BufferEnlargementPolicy enlargementPolicy)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to test enlargement of an image's domain
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - source image path on disk
        xMargin - Width of the margin to add on both sides
        yMargin - Height of the margin to add on both sides
        zMargin - Depth of the margin to add on both sides
        enlargementPolicy - Specifies the policy to initialize the new voxel values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • testInsertSlices

        public static void testInsertSlices(java.lang.String inputImageFile,
                                    int zCoordMin)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to test addition of slices from one image to another (without slice copy)
        Parameters:
        inputImageFile - source image path on disk, which shall be added to itself.
        zCoordMin - The minimal depth coordinate of the slices of image within the resulting image. The first slice (with coordinate Z=0) of image is mapped onto the slice with coordinate Z=zCoordMin.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
